column4: can someone explain to me why I can have an active network connection on a device that networkmanager knows about, but yet have networkmanager think there's no active device?
if i click on the network manager icon it brings up the summary window which says No active connection
if you do not need several network profiles (i.e. you alway connect to the same router) i would uninstall network manager altogether. Does more bad than good in such a case

#kubuntu will know about that, speaking of ubuntu (gnome ) there's no problem in uninstalling network-manger. There might be a naming confusion: knetwork manger is different from the nm-applet used for managing multiple network profiles
haven't used KDE for years, but i know that KDE had some app named knetwork manager for years, that is different from the lately introduced nm-applet
i checked nm-tool and even that is reporting that there's no devices
this is a laptop and its got a wired and wireless - of which the wireless is connected
any thoughts about my networkmanager issues?
i did not completly understand your problem yet. So you have a box where the wireless worked out of the box, but the wired ethernaet does not?
I have a box where both wired and wireless work, but i'm connected via wireless
I have openvpn setup, but network manager keeps resetting my connection
try disabling ipv6 first. some routers don't like it
